Package org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels

Class PaymentChannelV2ServerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels.PaymentChannelServerState
      • org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels.PaymentChannelV2ServerState
  • public class PaymentChannelV2ServerState
extends PaymentChannelServerState
    Version 2 of the payment channel state machine - uses CLTV opcode transactions instead of multisig transactions.

      • close

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Transaction> close​(@Nullable
                                                                             org.bouncycastle.crypto.params.KeyParameter userKey)
                                                                      throws InsufficientMoneyException
        Description copied from class: PaymentChannelServerState

        Closes this channel and broadcasts the highest value payment transaction on the network.

        Specified by:
        close in class PaymentChannelServerState
        Parameters:
        userKey - The AES key to use for decryption of the private key. If null then no decryption is required.
        Returns:
        a future which completes when the provided multisig contract successfully broadcasts, or throws if the broadcast fails for some reason. Note that if the network simply rejects the transaction, this future will never complete, a timeout should be used.
        Throws:
        InsufficientMoneyException - If the payment tx would have cost more in fees to spend than it is worth.
